title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez convicted of fraud for using a stolen identity to get government benefits and vote illegally.
Since 2005, she collected about $400,000 in Social Security, Section 8, and SNAP benefits using false documents.
Orovio-Hernandez faces a mandatory two-year sentence for aggravated identity theft and potential deportation post-sentence.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in his Celtics debut, helping them defeat the Heat 98-96.
Payton Pritchard sparked a third-quarter rally, scoring 16 points in 11 minutes to shift momentum against the Heat.
Derrick White overcame a slow start, scoring 17 points in the second half, including key three-pointers for the Celtics.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady posted support for the Patriots and owner Robert Kraft on Instagram before Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Brady initially stated he had no preference for the Super Bowl's outcome but later expressed support for his former team.
Brady faced criticism from former teammate Vince Wilfork and player Robert Spillane for not publicly backing the Patriots sooner.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Matthew Stafford won NFL MVP over Drake Maye by six points, sparking debate among fans and analysts.
Jeff Saturday argued Drake Maye was more deserving due to his dual-threat capabilities and performance with less support.
Mina Kimes supported Maye for MVP, citing his statistical superiority and higher efficiency compared to Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' defense plans to pressure Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, who struggled under pressure during the regular season.
Patriots QB Drake Maye may exploit Seahawks' 29th-ranked defense in yards per rush allowed to quarterbacks by using his running ability.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane's ankle injury could impact New England's run defense against Seahawks RB Kenneth Walker.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Quarterback Drake Maye does not have an injury designation and is expected to play in Sunday's Super Bowl.
Patriots linebackers Harold Landry (knee) and Robert Spillane (ankle) are listed as questionable for the Super Bowl.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is also questionable with a hamstring injury, despite full participation in practices.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' (2016), a Western film, is now streaming on Netflix.
'Splitsville' (2025), a romantic comedy, is available to watch on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, including NBC's tape-delayed coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' has become a rallying cry for the New England Patriots.
The phrase helped inspire a dramatic season turnaround, leading the Patriots to the Super Bowl against the odds.
Despite facing legal issues, Diggs remains a key leader and motivator for the Patriots on and off the field.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, a 34-year-old from North Attleboro, is running her first marathon, the Boston Marathon, in 2026.
Demeris, part of the MGH Marathon Team, aims to raise funds for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund.
The MGH Fund supports causes including Emergency Response, Cancer Care & Research, and the Home Base Program for veterans.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets is closing its South End location in June after 28 years due to costly building updates.
Neighborhood opposition blocked The Croft School from taking over the space, preserving it as retail or food-use.
The Croft School withdrew plans for expansion after community concerns; Foodie's continues operating in South Boston.
